com.ibm.jikes.skij.util
Class Tracer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.jikes.skij.util.Tracer
public class Tracer
extends Object

The Tracer class provides a hierarchical debugging trace. Programs can insert tracing calls into code. The tracer has a notion of a current level which indicates how far to indent messages.

There are three basic trace-generating methods: tracePrint prints a string at the current level, traceIn prints a message and moves in one level, while traceOut moves out one or more levels before printing a message. The idea is that you can surround a body of code with a traceIn/traceOut pair, and any tracing messages produced during the execution of that code will be suitably indented. traceIn returns an integer value representing the new level. This number may be passed to traceOut in order to back up to the appropriate level. This is useful in the case of exceptions which might bypass some traceOuts.
